meanings.definition: A person who supervises and directs the work of others.
meanings.sent1: The bosser at the office ensures everyone follows the rules.
meanings.sent2: The new bosser is responsible for managing the team efficiently.
meanings.sent3: The bosser decided to have a team-building day to boost morale.
meanings.sent4: She was like the captain of a ship, the bosser guiding the crew.
meanings.sent5: The bosser's role is crucial in maintaining a productive work environment.

meanings.definition: To work as a boss or supervisor.
meanings.sent1: I will bosser the team during the project to ensure success.
meanings.sent2: She bossered the department with confidence and skill.
meanings.sent3: He likes to bosser around, but we know he means well.
meanings.sent4: She bossered the situation like a seasoned leader.
meanings.sent5: Bossering effectively requires good communication and organization.

meanings.definition: To order someone around in a domineering manner.
meanings.sent1: Stop trying to bosser me around all the time!
meanings.sent2: She always bossered her siblings when they played together.
meanings.sent3: He tried to bosser the cat into playing fetch, but it didn't work.
meanings.sent4: The wind seemed to bosser the trees into dancing wildly.
meanings.sent5: She felt frustrated when her friend tried to bosser her decisions.
